metadata.title: CVE-2020-6073 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the TXTrecord-parsing functionality of Videolabs libmicrodns 0.1.0. When parsingthe RDATA section in a TXT record in mDNS messages, multiple integeroverflows can be triggered, leading to a denial of service. An attacker cansend an mDNS message to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmicrodns0 - 0.0.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
libvlc5 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-data - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libmicrodns package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.0.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
vlc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3').
